metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11763 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Failure to correctly handle null bytes when processing HTML entitiesresulted in Firefox incorrectly parsing these entities. This could have ledto HTML comment text being treated as HTML which could have led to XSS in aweb application under certain conditions. It could have also led to HTMLentities being masked from filters - enabling the use of entities to maskthe actual characters of interest from filters. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 70, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR < 68.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
